titlepage.titleproper: Register of the Ferdinand I, Czar of Bulgaria Papers, 1846-1956
titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 1998 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Ferdinand I, Czar of Bulgaria Papers,
did.abstract: Correspondence, memoranda, and reports, relating to Bulgarian foreign relations and domestic policy, the Bulgarian role in the Balkan Wars and World War I, and Bulgarian dynastic affairs.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Ferdinand I, Czar of Bulgaria Papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1987.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

eventgrp.event: Proclaimed independence of Bulgaria and took the title of czar

chronitem.event: Abdicated in favor of his son, Boris

scopecontent.p: Correspondence, memoranda, reports, and printed matter, arranged chronologically and by physical form or subject within each year.

note.p: This collection is only available on microfilm. A guide to reel contents, available at the Hoover Institution Archives reading room, converts the box numbers listed below to microfilm reel numbers.

did.unittitle: III Veliko Narodno Sobranie v Tyrnovo, minutes of meeting at which Ferdinand was elected to Bulgarian throne
"Arkhiv zu Wien. Auszuge und Dokumente", excerpts from miscellaneous correspondence, mostly diplomatic corps
Incoming, congratulatory telegrams sent to Prince Ferdinand upon accession to throne of Bulgaria
Drafts of letters accepting Bulgarian invitation to the throne
Copies of outgoing correspondence, including letter to Alexander III, Emperor of Russia and Franz-Josef, Emperor of Austria
Rusko-Turska voina 1877-78 g. Deistviiata na Ruschushkiia otriad, printed copy
1888, correspondence, "Arkhiv zu Wien. Auszuge und Dokumente", excerpts and summaries of official correspondence
1889, correspondence, "Arkhiv zu Wien. Auszuge und Dokumente," summaries and transcripts of official correspondence
1890, correspondence, "Arkhiv zu Wien. Auszuge und Dokumente," summaries and transcripts of official correspondence
Summaries and transcripts of official correspondence
Printed matter, "Posleden' apel' G.S. Stambolovu", printed leaflet
Grekov, D., includes miscellaneous diplomatic correspondence
Summaries and transcripts of official correpondence
Diplomatic, includes P. Dimitrov, Bulgarian Diplomatic Agent in Constantinople, B. Goranov, Bulgarian Diplomatic Agent in Belgrade and Teodorov, Bulgarian Diplomatic Agent in Bucharest
Program, address to deputies and other miscellaneous material re opening of National Assembly
"Relation du voyage de S. A. R. Monseigneur le Prince de Bulgarie, Constantinople"
"Unterredung mit Sr. Koniglichen Hoheit dem Fursten Ferdinand v. Bulgarien"
Military and naval matters, including "Nadezhda" incident
Minutes of meeting, National Assembly, Nov. 9, 1898
Dobrovich, S. and "Kantseliariia na Negovo Tsrsko Visochestvo kniaz'te"
Outgoing, includes drafts of official addresses
"Ego Siiatel'stvu Grafu V.N. Lamzdorfu ot Makedonsko-Adrianopol'skoi Emigratsii"
Edward VII, King of Great Britain
General, including material regarding the Macedonian crisis
Draft of agreement between Bulgaria and Serbia
"Projet d'un canal maritime du Lac de Devno a la mer", blueprint
Miscellaneous, includes calling cards, printed menus, invitations
Alexandrine of Saxe-Coburg-Gotha, personal papers, including will
Clementine, Princess of Saxe-Coburg-Gotha, includes other, miscellaneous family correspondence
Ministry of Agriculture and Commerce, draft project
"Declaration de la Sublime Porte aux ambassadeur d'Autriche-Hongrie et de Russie"
Macedonian situation, reports on, in German
Serbia, drafts of agreements between Bulgaria and Serbia, includes miscellaneous related material
Ministry of War, including miscellaneous military matters
Kuropatkin, Gen. A., "Vypiski iz dnevnika...za vremia prebyvaniia ego v Bolgarii v Sentiabre 1902 goda", 1902
Brief history of Ferdinand's reign, handwritten draft
Clementine, Princess of Saxe-Coburg-Gotha, includes holograph letter from Franz-Josef, Emperor of Austria
"Discours du Ministre des Affaires Etrangeres", typescript
Reports re situation in Austro-Hungary, typescript
Sermon, funeral of Clementine, Princess of Saxe-Coburg-Gotha
Miscellaneous, includes invitations, menus, financial papers
List of personnel employed in royal palace
Marriage of Ferdinand and Princess Eleonore Reuss
Draft of mutual defense agreement between Bulgaria and Turkey, includes Bulgarian and Turkish texts, typescript
Plans for military manoeuvres, Austro-Hungarian army
Reports from Paris, by N. Stanchov
"Programa za t"rzhestvenoto otkrivane...XIV...Narodno S"branie", printed copy
Program, reception in Budapest, Sept. 1908, handwritten and printed material
Clippings and handwritten excerpts from press, including royal visit to Serbia
"Doklad do Negovo Velichestvo Tsaria" and "Zakonoproekt za veroizpovedaniiata v Tsarstvo Belgariia", typescript
Belgarska Tsarska Legatsiia, Belgrad, reports and correspondence
Belgarsko Generalno Konsulstvo v Solune, correspondence and reports
Military matters, including reports on Turkish and Serbian armies
Ministry of Foreign Affairs, external affairs
Education, Princes Boris and Kiril, typescript
"Introduction et chapitre premier. Peuples des Balkans. Leurs groupements." Typescript
Bulgarian Exarch in Constantinople, IOsif I
Marie, Queen of Rumania to Eleonore, Queen of Bulgaria
Lists of officers presented with order "Za khrabrost'", typescript
Treaties, "Traite d'Alliance defensive entre la Bulgarie et la Grece", handwritten and "Convention Militaire", typescript
Conference de Saint-James, lists of delegates and protocols
Report, "Les frontieres de l'Albanie d'apres les actes internationaux", typescript
Railroads, "Izlozhenie na motivite k"m" zakonoproekta za razshirenie mrezhatana Belgarskite d"rzhavni zheleznitsi", address to national representatives, printed copy. Also includes map, 1911
Clippings and summaries of newspaper articles
List of officers presented with order "Za khrabrost'"
Treaty between Serbia and Greece, French, typescript
"Promemoria uber die Lage Bulgariens, Anfangs, Dezember 1913", typescript
Director of Postal, Telegraph and Telephone Services
Bulgarian Legation in London and The Hague
Bulgarian diplomatic outposts in various countries
Russia, conditions and events, including assassination of Rasputin, reports (in German)
World War I, reports (in German) and maps
